P was a labial primitive ;—it was produced by a contact of the lips, and a forcible impulse of breath.

T was a dental primitive, and formed by a contact of the tip of the tongue, with the roots of the upper teeth.

S may be called sub-dentalj’ formed by the act of pressing the lower teeth with the tip of the tongue, so forcibly,as to bend its surface almost into contact with the upper gums.

‘L, pronounced as the Welslc LI, ma)v be named a gin- gival. It is formed, by the act of placing the tongue evenly against the upper gums, and forcing out breath on both sides.

C, or K, was a guttural primitive, formed by the con- tact of the tongue, and the root of the palate.
